faqs.question: What areas do you serve?
faqs.answer: We serve the entire Phoenix metro area including Phoenix, Scottsdale, Mesa, Tempe, Chandler, Gilbert, Glendale, Peoria, Surprise, and Goodyear. Our service radius extends approximately 50 miles from central Phoenix.

faqs.question: Are you licensed and insured?
faqs.answer: Yes, we are fully licensed (ROC #298847), bonded, and insured. All our technicians are NATE-certified and EPA 608 certified for refrigerant handling.

faqs.question: Do you offer financing?
faqs.answer: Yes, we offer flexible financing options for new system installations. We work with multiple lenders to find options that fit your budget, including 0% interest plans for qualified buyers.

faqs.question: Do you provide free estimates?
faqs.answer: Yes, we provide free in-home estimates for new system installations. For repair diagnostics, there is a service call fee that gets waived if you proceed with the repair.

faqs.question: How quickly can you come for an AC repair?
faqs.answer: We offer same-day service for most AC repairs. For emergencies, we have technicians available 24/7 and typically arrive within 2-4 hours of your call.

faqs.question: How much does AC repair cost?
faqs.answer: Repair costs vary depending on the issue. Simple fixes like capacitor replacement may cost $150-$300, while compressor repairs can range from $400-$1,500. We always provide upfront pricing before any work begins.

faqs.question: Should I repair or replace my AC unit?
faqs.answer: Generally, if your system is over 10-15 years old, requires frequent repairs, or the repair cost exceeds 50% of a new system's price, replacement may be more cost-effective. We'll give you an honest assessment.

faqs.question: Do you repair all AC brands?
faqs.answer: Yes, our technicians are trained to repair all major brands including Carrier, Trane, Lennox, Goodman, Rheem, Ruud, American Standard, and more.

faqs.question: How long does AC installation take?
faqs.answer: A standard AC replacement typically takes 4-8 hours and is completed in one day. Complete system replacements including ductwork may take 1-2 days.

faqs.question: What size AC do I need?
faqs.answer: Proper sizing requires a load calculation that considers your home's square footage, insulation, windows, and other factors. We perform this calculation during our free estimate to ensure you get the right size.

faqs.question: What brands do you install?
faqs.answer: We're a Carrier Factory Authorized Dealer and also install Trane, Lennox, and other premium brands. We'll recommend the best option based on your needs and budget.

faqs.question: What warranty comes with a new AC?
faqs.answer: New systems typically include manufacturer warranties of 5-10 years on parts and compressor. We also provide our own 1-year labor warranty on all installations.

faqs.question: How often should I have my AC serviced?
faqs.answer: We recommend having your AC serviced at least once a year, ideally in spring before the summer heat arrives. Heating systems should be serviced in fall. Twice-yearly service is best for optimal performance.

faqs.question: What's included in an AC tune-up?
faqs.answer: Our 21-point tune-up includes cleaning coils, checking refrigerant levels, inspecting electrical connections, lubricating moving parts, testing thermostat calibration, and replacing filters.

faqs.question: How often should I change my air filter?
faqs.answer: Standard 1-inch filters should be changed monthly during heavy use. Higher-quality 4-inch filters can last 3-6 months. Homes with pets or allergies may need more frequent changes.

faqs.question: Do you offer maintenance plans?
faqs.answer: Yes, our maintenance plans include annual tune-ups, priority scheduling, discounts on repairs, and no overtime charges for emergency service. Plans start at just $15/month.

faqs.question: What qualifies as an HVAC emergency?
faqs.answer: An HVAC emergency includes complete system failure during extreme temperatures, gas leaks, burning smells, carbon monoxide alarms, or any situation that threatens health or safety.

faqs.question: Do you charge extra for nights and weekends?
faqs.answer: We do have a modest emergency service fee for after-hours calls, but we don't charge excessive overtime rates like some companies. Our pricing is always transparent and upfront.

faqs.question: What should I do while waiting for emergency service?
faqs.answer: For AC emergencies, close blinds to block sun, turn off heat-generating appliances, and stay hydrated. For heating emergencies, use space heaters safely and dress in layers. For gas smells, leave the house immediately.
